issue.title: Update dependency rollup to v0.61.1

repository.name: scouting-frontend
repository.description: Frontend for the Pigmice Scouting website

issue.body:
This Pull Request updates dependency [rollup](https://github.com/rollup/rollup) from `v0.60.7` to `v0.61.1`



<details>
<summary>Release Notes</summary>

### [`v0.61.1`](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​0611)
[Compare Source](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v0.61.0...697f36d052936c9008736215ae48093bedc99851)
*2018-06-21*
* Do not try to deconflict "undefined" ([#​2291](`https://github.com/rollup/rollup/pull/2291`))
* Properly track values for loop interator declarations and reassigned namespaces, add smoke test ([#​2292](`https://github.com/rollup/rollup/pull/2292`))

---

### [`v0.61.0`](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​0610)
[Compare Source](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v0.60.7...v0.61.0)
*2018-06-20*
* Declare file dependencies via transform plugin hooks ([#​2259](`https://github.com/rollup/rollup/pull/2259`))
* Handle undefined values when evaluating conditionals ([#​2264](`https://github.com/rollup/rollup/pull/2264`))
* Handle known undefined properties when evaluating conditionals ([#​2265](`https://github.com/rollup/rollup/pull/2265`))
* Access watch events via the plugin context ([#​2261](`https://github.com/rollup/rollup/pull/2261`))
* Add option to suppress `__esModule` flag in output ([#​2287](`https://github.com/rollup/rollup/pull/2287`))
* Fix issue when re-declaring variables, track reassignments in more cases ([#​2279](`https://github.com/rollup/rollup/pull/2279`))
* Add VSCode debug settings ([#​2276](`https://github.com/rollup/rollup/pull/2276`))

---

</details>

issue.title: rollup 0.61.0 with rollup-plugin-node-resolve 3.3.0 leads to messed up undefined values

repository.name: rollup-plugin-node-resolve
repository.description: This module has moved and is now available at @rollup/plugin-node-resolve / https://github.com/rollup/plugins/blob/master/packages/node-resolve

body:
Further reduction. This seems to be triggered by an `import`. Comment it out to get an unbroken `undefined`.

https://rollupjs.org/repl?version=0.61.0&

issue.title: Hotfix: Do not deconflict "undefined"
issue.body:
Resolves #2290

With the new "undefined" literal logic, undefined was tracked as a variable on module level which lead to instances in different modules being deconflicted. Very simple reproduction:
https://rollupjs.org/repl?version=0.61.0&

This fixes this by declaring it as a global variable instead.

body: REALLY sorry about this one. Fix at #2291, hope to be able to release it later today.

In order to track `undefined` as value in conditionals, we added a pseudo-variable to track it. Unfortunately, it was done on module level instead of the global level as we did not consider that in this situation, the deconflicting logic would kick in and start renaming instances if there is more than one module. And apparently nowhere in our tests, we had a situation where there was both an "undefined" and an import in the same file... ðŸ™„

Here it yanked output for [core-js/_uid.js](https://github.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/v2.5.7/modules/_uid.js#L4) module.
Thank you for preparing hotfix so quickly
@lukastaegert this may be a good reason to incorporate some smoke tests into the RollupJS release process to test building and running popular libraries.

Of course it would be nice to have more smoke tests in the future for "popular libraries" other than rollup ðŸ˜‰. The problem which might cause some work here, though, is that a good smoke test should have some meaningful tests to check basic functionality is available. For rollup, we already have a very detailed test suite. I remember @kzc mentioning that when developing uglify-es, rollup's test suite played an integral part for them in finding issues so we are not the first to do so...

issue.title: Integration test/examples are failing

repository.name: enigma.js
repository.description: JavaScript library for consuming Qlik's Associative Engine.

issue.body:
We need to investigate, especially before release of a new version since this potentially indicates a broken npm package on master right now.

body:
>  I remember @kzc mentioning that when developing uglify-es, rollup's test suite played an integral part for them in finding issues

It was indeed. Until TypeScript was adopted. ;-P.

There aren't many large ECMAScript 2015+ code bases with extensive test suites that are easily run. I also tested against BublÃ© and Butternut. I changed the Rollup config to not transpile the code and leave it in the original form and then minified it in-situ and ran "npm test". The source code had to be minified before Rollup unwound the imports and exports. Several bugs in Rollup, BublÃ© and Acorn were also exposed in the process - a virtuous circle.
